soc.server

Interface GameMessageHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SOCGameMessageHandler

    public interface GameMessageHandler
    Server interface to handle inbound game-specific messages for a type of game; each game type has a GameMessageHandler and a GameHandler. See GameHandler class javadoc for concepts and boundaries.
    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    GameHandler.getMessageHandler()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean dispatch(SOCGame ga, SOCMessageForGame mes, Connection c)
      Process one inbound command message from a client player of this game.

    • Method Detail

      • dispatch

        boolean dispatch(SOCGame ga,
                 SOCMessageForGame mes,
                 Connection c)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Process one inbound command message from a client player of this game.

        Some game messages (such as player sits down, or board reset voting) are handled the same for all game types. These are handled at SOCServer; they should be ignored here and not appear in your switch statement.

        Called from InboundMessageQueue message handler loop via the SOCMessageDispatcher. Caller will catch any thrown Exceptions.

        Parameters:
        ga - Game in which client c is sending msg. Never null; from SOCMessageForGame.getGame().
        mes - Message from client c. Never null.
        c - Client sending msg. Never null. Connection.getData() won't be null unless mes implements SOCMessageFromUnauthClient.
        Returns:
        true if processed, false if ignored or unknown message type
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
